body_html:
Are you using python 2? On newer ubuntu releases (14.04.3 for me), pip defaults to pip3, using python 3

pip --version
pip 7.1.2 from /usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages (python 3.4)

So to correctly install the tensorflow wheel, you'd need to specifically call pip for python 2 with pip2
body_text:
Are you using python 2? On newer ubuntu releases  (14.04.3 for me), pip defaults to pip3, using python 3
pip --version
pip 7.1.2 from /usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages (python 3.4)

So to correctly install the tensorflow wheel, you'd need to specifically call pip for python 2 with pip2
body:
Are you using python 2? On newer ubuntu releases  (14.04.3 for me), pip defaults to pip3, using python 3

```
pip --version
pip 7.1.2 from /usr/local/lib/python3.4/dist-packages (python 3.4)
```

So to correctly install the tensorflow wheel, you'd need to specifically call pip for python 2 with `pip2`
